  • Constructor Details

    • CheckersView

      public CheckersView(BoardGamesView menuView)
      Constructs an instance of the CheckersView class
      Parameters:
      menuView - : A reference to the main View class

    • CheckersView

      public CheckersView(BoardGamesView menuView, String name1, String name2)
      Constructs an instance of the CheckersView class with names for player 1 and player 2.
      Parameters:
      menuView - : A reference to the main View class
      name1 - : The name of player one
      name2 - : The name of player two

  • Method Details

    • setupScene

      private javafx.scene.Scene setupScene()
      Creates a scene object with all the functionality required to play the checkers game. Does not create a Stage for itself, but rather just creates the scene to put on the stage

    • loadSave

      private ObjectInputStream loadSave()
      Loads whatever instance of the checkers game is currently saved in the file "save_checkers.dat". If the file does not exist, then it will simply return null. Finally, it deletes the file to prevent save corruption issues.
      Returns:
      The ObjectInputStream representing the saved game.

    • saveGame

      private void saveGame()
      Stores the current CheckersInstance object into the file "save_checkers.dat" as an ObjectOutputStream

    • deleteSave

      private void deleteSave()
      Deletes whatever saved instance of the game currently exists. This is typically done once a game is finished or a new save is instanciated.

    • setUpTop

      private void setUpTop()
      Sets the top bar of the main window

      Creates a bar menu item collection with three menu items, allowing you to start a new game, save and exit, or exit without saving. If the game is over, then pressing the button to exit while saving will just delete the file again.

    • setUpMiddle

      private void setUpMiddle()
      Sets up the main checkers board

      StackPane is centered within the BorderPane mainWindow with a 6 pixel boundary on all sides. Has a green background with a 1 pixel black bar along each grid pane. 20 pixel radius circles centered in GridPanes of radius 23, giving a 2 pixel boundary between the end of the circle and the one pixel black border around each pane. Circles are initially transparent, but color can change depending on the state of the board to either black or white.

    • setupCurrPiece

      private BoardSquare setupCurrPiece(int rowNum, int colNum)
      Sets up a BoardSquare object to place in the GridPane object at row/col location rowNum/colNum
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : the row location this piece is going in
      colNum - : the column location this piece is going to
      Returns:
      the BoardSquare constructed for this location

    • setUpBottom

      private void setUpBottom()
      adds a label that tracks the score of the white pieces and the black pieces

    • handleUserInput

      private void handleUserInput(double xPos, double yPos)
      Processes the user's click

      Takes the exact location the user clicked on the GUI and determines if the click was on a tile within the grid. If so, then it finds which tile was clicked and sends those values to controller to see if it is a valid input or should be ignored.

      Parameters:
      xPos - : The x-coordinate of the pixel the user clicked.
      yPos - : The y-coordinate of the pixel the user clicked.

    • handleError

      private void handleError(String errorMessage)
      Displays an error message to the app via an ERROR-type Alert. Solely used for testing, and should never be called during expected gameplay.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - : The message to be displayed in the Alert. Should be informative regarding what went wrong.

    • startGame

      private void startGame()
      Starts the game, passing the saved data from "checkers_save.dat"

    • isNull

      private boolean isNull(int[] selectedIndex)
      Checks whether the passed array is equal to the value {-1, -1}, which is the null location, or not.
      Parameters:
      selectedIndex - : The array whose location is being checked.

    • movePiece

      private void movePiece(CheckersInstance newBoardState)
      Moves a piece on the gui from the location the user clicked the piece on to the location the user decided to move the piece to.
      Parameters:
      newBoardState - : The CheckersInstance containing the information to determine the user choices.

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer

    • endGame

      private void endGame()
      Ends the game by showing an alert to the user telling them which player won.

    • clearSelectedMoves

      private void clearSelectedMoves(CheckersInstance newBoardState)
      Clears all the selected moves currently on the screen. This should occur whenever a new owned piece was clicked by the current player or when the player moves a piece.

    • setCellPane

      private void setCellPane(BoardSquare modifiedSquare, int currBoardState)
      Literally just goes over all possible values the currBoardState could be and modifies modifiedSquare accordingly
      Parameters:
      modifiedSquare - : the BoardSquare being modified
      currBoardState - : an int stating the curr value of the board at the index of modifiedSquare.

    • getScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
      Gives the Scene object this class created
      Returns:
      this.scene
